topic_metadata.title: How can i cite without paranthesis

posts.cooked:
So I am a heavy user of the apa citatitation style because that is basically standard in my field. But I cannot seem to figure out how to cite within a text and as such without paranthesis.

I am super confused this should be an option but I honestly donâ€™t understand the Documentation on this.
Can someone help me and point out the way this is supposed to be done?
posts.raw:
So I am a heavy user of the apa citatitation style because that is basically standard in my field.  But I cannot seem to figure out how to cite within a text and as such without paranthesis.

I am super confused this should be an option but I honestly don't understand the Documentation on this.
Can someone help me and point out the way this is supposed to be done?

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked:
Hello and welcome @toIhr!
Would using form: "prose" work for you?
You can take a look at the docs here.
posts.raw:
Hello and welcome @toIhr!
Would using `form: "prose"` work for you?
You can take a look at the docs [here](https://typst.app/docs/reference/model/cite/#:~:text=%23cite(%3Cnetwok%3E%2C%20form%3A%20%22prose%22)%0Ashow%20the%20outsized%20effects%20of%0Apirate%20life%20on%20the%20human%20psyche.).
